intro: Elettariopsis wandokthong, commonly known as the Thai arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and striking inflorescence. The plant produces a starchy tuberous root that is used as a food source. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its nutritional value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
